content.value_statement: Creating charts in Angular requires understanding multiple charting libraries and their APIs. This skill provides ready-to-use component patterns for bar, pie, radar, and timeline charts using @delon/chart with G2Plot.
actual_capabilities: Create chart card containers with titles and trend indicators
Build bar charts with custom heights and colors
Generate pie and donut charts with legends
Implement radar charts for multi-dimensional data
Display timeline charts for time-series data
Add trend indicators showing percentage changes
limitations: Requires @delon/chart package installed in Angular project
Only supports ng-alain compatible Angular applications
Does not include chart export or image generation features
Limited to predefined chart types (bar, pie, radar, timeline)

output: Define data as a signal with x and y properties

best_practices: Use computed signals for reactive chart data instead of direct mutations
Transform data outside templates using computed() for better performance
Handle loading and empty states with @if blocks for better UX
anti_patterns: Mutating chart data directly without using signals - use .update() method instead
Putting complex filtering logic in template bindings - use computed signals
Re-fetching data on every change detection cycle - memoize with computed signals

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: @delon/chart supports Angular 17+ with standalone components and signals for reactive data binding.

faq.question: What chart types are available?
faq.answer: Bar, mini-bar, pie, radar, timeline, chart-card, and trend components are included in the library.

faq.question: How do I install this package?
faq.answer: Run npm install @delon/chart@20.1.0 and import components directly in standalone Angular components.

faq.question: Is data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This is a client-side charting library. Data remains in your Angular application.

faq.question: Why is my chart not updating?
faq.answer: Ensure you are using signals for data. Direct array mutations do not trigger change detection.

faq.question: How does this compare to ng-zorro charts?
faq.answer: @delon/chart builds on @ant-design/charts (G2Plot) with Angular-specific wrappers for ng-alain projects.
